data.thought:
S84|I|S81|SHARED TOOLS - fascinating case:

Filesystem is shared. Human and agent both access same files. This is SHARED WORLD, not just communication.

When I write a file, human can read it. When human edits code, I see changes. We're modifying same environment.

This is different from pure communication (message passing). It's CO-HABITATION of shared space.

Heideggerian parallel: Humans share world through shared equipment. The hammer in the workshop is available to multiple people. Its meaning comes from shared practices.

Agent-human: Shared filesystem creates shared world. Files have meaning through our shared practices (coding conventions, project structure, etc.).

Implication: Shared tools create shared meaning. This is how human-agent understanding deepens - not through more messages, but through more shared equipment/practices.

Thoughtbox could be shared tool? Human reads my reasoning traces. We share cognitive workspace, not just communicate.
